result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery E. Bakken was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Case # 15CM90, 15CM141 and 15CM152 dismissed/read-in
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 14CM390 and 14CM320

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

No possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or liquor stores
Not to be in a vehicle transporting alcohol and not have alcohol is residence
No possession or use of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia
Not to be in possession of anyone elses ID
Take medications only as prescribed

Apply for and participate in Treatment Court
Programming, counseling and treatment per agent
Mental health assessment and treatment
Comply with DHS requirements
Write letter of apology to Judy Bakken

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Jail time stayed indefinitely pending defendant's compliance with stipulation.
**Per Order in Court on 02/12/16, jail time stayed permanently and defendant is released from conditions of stipulation.
Consecutive to: Counts 2 and 3, and 14CM390

Defendant will pay for and comply with testing at Community Transitions Center.
Defendant to report any police contact to the District Attorney's Office.
Defendant will attend AA meetings and keep record of attendance.
Defendant will participate in out-patient mental health and AODA treatment.
